title: Why is it okay for Mages and Marksmen to get ahead and carry..
body:
...but not okay when Assassins or Skirmishers get ahead and carry?

So it's okay to be fed and sweep an entire team as long as you have the safety of range. But if you do it as a melee it is suddenly "toxic" and "anti-fun to face".

I'm sorry. I'd much rather have somebody dive my team get CC'd and die than wipe all 5 of us from next galaxy.

Skirmishers tend to have slightly more tankiness and mobility than ranged champions.

Assassins tend to be burstier and more mobile.

But neither gets to sit 750 units behind their tank so they kinda need that. They are also squishy as hell compared to Tanks and Fighters. So they die almost as fast as ADCs and Mages.

Does the community just not know they are also carry classes who do well when ahead?

**EDIT: So about 2/3rds of comments consist of "They are mobile". No duh... okay, take that away, now you come up with a way for a squishy, damage based melee to get to an ADC before they kill them with 3 crits... Unless you think the only melees that should exist are immobile ~~target dummies~~ tanky ones that you can easily kite.**

EDIT 2: A new wave of comments are "they can outplay you!"

And uhm... ADCs cannot?

https://youtu.be/mWxyYWE2oOc

In fact it is top tier ADC mains a lot of people think of when they hear "Outplay". I mean don't try telling gosu, sneaky, doublelift, Imaqtpie or other top level ADC mains they cannot outplay people when ahead. Or even behind.

For mages try telling that to faker, hai or any other top tier player that plays mages.

But even down here in Silver I see Lux's outplay Zed's all the time. And Ashe's flashing out of Riven's knockup, stunning her then killing her in about 2-3 AAs while lifestealing any damage she took.

The difference between an Assassin/Skirmisher and ADC/Mage the former is better at solokills when in small fights. Allowing them to be good split pushers. But otherwise does the same job of killing things from a much more dangerous range. Making them far worse at sieges, objectives and team fighting. An assassin or Skirmisher relies on catching you in a bad spot or their tank engaging first. Just as much as and ADC or mage relies on you making a stupid engagement or their tank engaging first.

Both are team reliant. You cannot "carry" if your team isn't in a position to be carried. 

And I'm sorry, when the roles are reversed and a Twitch or Lucian is super fed. A Skirmisher or assassin feels just as helpless trying to ever get on them and deal enough damage before they lifesteal it back. As an ADC feels when a Skirmisher or Assassin is fed. That is the price of hypercarry potential. You rely on your team and getting fed. When behind you feel helpless.

At least a mage when behind usually still offers strong utilities. Like my main mages Malzahar and Lux.

**Edit 3: The current argument is "counterplay". The counterplay for all squishy carries is the same. Burst, CC, Exhaust, warding, defensive items/lifesteal and positioning. Those things are easier to apply when the attacking champion is melee. Which is why melee champions MUST have some level of mitigating your defense if they play well. Also talk about limited counterplay... ADCs do most of their DPS and healing based on typically undodgeable right clicks from 500-700 range. Mages are compensated by having AoE, burst and utilities instead. Just as mages are compensated melees get mobility and ways to dodge damage and/or CC. That is fair.**

**And yes. Melees can, if not CC'd or exhausted, escape after going in. Most mages and ADCs never have to "go in" to begin with. Their safety is range. Yet most of them still have some form of escape or CC and items like Scimitar and Zonya's work as well on them as melees.**

**A large part of why Melees "Can't miss" is because they are in melee range. Ahri is unlikely to miss Charm from point blank either. The difference is she doesn't have to point blank.**

Yet to be convinced melee carries carrying is any more unfair than a fed Twitch killing an entire team in a few AAs or a Syndra one shotting somebody from 500+ range.

But in team fights and sieges they can be rendered useless while ADCs and Mages can still hide behind their tanks going "Pewpewpew" and killing your team.

Implying all out 5v5 team fights even do happen.

SoloQ is all about catching people out and just making picks to win the game.

Team fighting is only prevalent during tank metas where you need to force these kinds of engagements since Tanks can't really rely on picks.
And that doesn't matter when only bad players would be out by themselves.

If a Fiora or Akali is fed I heavily would suggest grouping. You can get objectives and towers and force them to contest it as 5. Where Skirmishers and assassins fall off hard. 

Also warding and not getting caught out are basic counterplay for anything in the game. And works on them too.

If you are a mage or ADC, the people they can one shot. You stay near your Vi, Sejauni, Leona, Shyvana, Nautilus, Moakai, Lee Sin, whomever is a big nono for those squishy, easily interrupted types.

Here's my theory.

If a fed Brand annihilates your team, you're mad yet at the same time you realzie you couldn't do much about it.

Now if a Fiora or Yasuo dives in and out of your team, putting themselves in harms way, and still whoops you all, then you get mad at them, yourself, and your team for not doing anything to stop them.

So it's like a multiplication of frustration.

That is what I am thinking. When people get swept under the rug by an ADC or Mage they can convince themselves their team was just not focusing or it was a bad engagement. But when say an Akali follows her tank in and obliterates a carry then escapes she was JUST in their grasp. So they convince themselves the champion design is the problem.

I'd say that neither are a problem in theory: even an ahead carry and be burst down if you can get the drop on them, and even an ahead assassin can be shutdown with coordinated teamwork.

The problem comes in when one of those can manage to both be ahead, melt enemies with ease, *and* become almost impossible to kill.
For example, when you have an assassin who can get in, kill someone, and get out before the team or their opponent can react, or when a ranged-bruiser can one-shot people while draining back any lost health and being almost impossible to kill.
Fair enough. But ADCs and Mages can become "impossible to kill" by merit of range and safety.

They're less squishy than a Mage or ADC as well due to needing higher base stats for being melee on top of having more room for a defensive item in their build like Cleaver, Maw, Bloodthirster, GA, etc.
